description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 3.1 Configure Network Devices

controls.title: Ensure IPv6 status is identified
controls.description: Internet Protocol Version 6 (IPv6) is the most recent version of Internet Protocol (IP). It is recommended that IPv6 be enabled and configured in accordance with Benchmark recommendations.
controls.remediation: Enable or disable IPv6 in accordance with system requirements and local site policy

controls.title: Ensure wireless interfaces are disabled
controls.description: Wireless networking is used when wired networks are unavailable. If wireless is not to be used, wireless devices can be disabled to reduce the potential attack surface.
controls.remediation: Run the following script to disable any wireless interfaces: # for driverdir in $(find /sys/class/net/*/ -type d -name wireless); do l_dname=$(basename $(dirname $driverdir)); echo "install $l_dname /bin/false" >> /etc/modprobe.d/disable-wireless.conf; done

controls.title: Ensure bluetooth services are not in use
controls.description: Bluetooth is a short-range wireless technology standard that is used for exchanging data between devices over short distances. An attacker may be able to find a way to access or corrupt your data.
controls.remediation: Run the following commands to stop bluetooth.service, and remove the bluez package: # systemctl stop bluetooth.service && yum remove bluez
